Description: Body sherd of Chian Grand Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed black; band of lotus buds in added white outline with added red centres fabove red and white bands; exterior: painted decoration consisting of flesh-coloured feet of a draped male figure to right; below, double guilloche pattern and wide black band..
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For a parallel regarding the subject matter, see British Museum 1888,0601.513.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0828) (phase 2)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
